page.title: 07SHETLAND TIMES 24TH MAY 1985
page.content: S THE NEW FISHING VESSEL,"ADONIS" WAS THE CENTRE OF ATTRACTION IN HAMNAVOE LAST WEEK.IT WAS LAUNCHED RECENTLY AT CAMPBELTON AND COST 800,000. THERE WAS AN ADVERTISEMENT THIS WEEK FOR THE BURRA REGATTA,BEING HELD FROM THURSDAY THE 30TH MAY TO SATURDAY 1ST JUNE.ON SATURDAY THERE WOULD BE SPORTS ON THE FOOTBALL PITCH. AS WELL AS SAILING RACES THERE WAS TO BE A FISHING COMPETITION CALLED THE "EELA". MR JOHN JAMES WILLIAMSON CAME BACK TO BURRA AFTER 55 YEARS IN NEW ZEALAND.HE HAD EMIGRATED WITH HIS FAMILY WHEN HE WAS 21 YEARS OLD.
